paragraphs: Starting from Friday, August 15, citizens of the Czech Republic no longer need to apply for an electronic visa for tourist trips to Vietnam. This was announced by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Czech Republic.
"The government of Vietnam has issued a resolution simplifying entry conditions for tourists from the Czech Republic and 11 other European countries."

Starting from August 15, 2025, Czech tourists are no longer required to obtain an electronic visa before flying to Vietnam. Now, for tourist trips up to 45 days, only a valid passport will be required.
"The visa-free entry program will be in effect until August 14, 2028," the department's statement said.
